p: We predicted the potential distribution of P. tenuifolia under different climatic scenarios using Maxent ( http://www.cs.princeton.edu/~schapire/maxent/, version 3.3.3k, [ 44]). The 20 environmental variables and 732 occurrences were used as inputs for Maxent. Of these records, 25% were randomly selected to be test data, and the remainder were used as training data. The “10th percentile training presence” was chosen as the threshold rule to remove biologically irrelevant noise from the model prediction maps [ 64, 80– 82] and resulted in reliable species distributions [ 83].
